text:
“What answer did you give him?” Dounia asked.

“I refused to take a message. He wants to see you,” Rodya replied.

“Why?” 

“He claims his passion is gone. He doesn’t want you with Luzhin.”

Dounia frowned. “What do you think of him?”

“I don’t understand. He offers money but says he’s poor. He talks of marriage yet forgets his own words.”

“Strange man,” Dounia whispered.

“Maybe mad,” Rodya said. “But I refused the money for you.”

“God rest Marfa Petrovna,” Pulcheria said. “We are blessed with this three thousand.”

“Just this morning, we had only three roubles,” Dounia added.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov expresses confusion about Svidrigaïlov's strange behavior and motives regarding Dounia, while Pulcheria Alexandrovna feels grateful for a financial windfall after Marfa Petrovna's death.
